ratings.question_text: The readings/cases/textbooks used in this course were __________ .

The workload for this course in comparison to other courses was ___________.
The pace of this class was ____________ for optimal learning.
Field trips were well designed and ran smoothly.
I learned a lot from field trips.
How clearly does the instructor provide explanations of conceptual material?
How responsive to student comments was the instructor?
I would give the instructor of this class an overall rating of:
I would give this course an overall rating of:
Apart from how well the course was taught, how valuable is the course to students with interests similar to yours?
Did you participate in a work group as part of this course?

narratives.question_text: Use the space below to comment on questions 1-14, if you wish
comments: Best course!!! I learned more from my time in Haiti than in my other classes combined

narratives.question_text: What were the best aspects of this course?
comments: The trip to Haiti! And the chance to reflect back on it afterwards as well.

Angel was far and away the saving grace of this class. Without her, all would be lost. She deserves enormous credit for making everything function as well as it did. The trip to Haiti was absolutely life-changing, and for that I am extremely grateful.

Best aspects are interaction between different sciences/schools, public health and F&ES.I appreciated a lot the discussions on development and international aid.Visiting HAS and understanding their work is a highlight of the course.
Working with local counterparts

narratives.question_text: What aspects of this course need the most improvement?
comments: I think there could have been more work to promote student engagement and a more seminar style course rather than lectures. For example if instead of presenting our group's progress in powerpoints to the whole class, if we divided up into groups with reprentatives from each group to talk and learn more about the other projects I think this would have been more engaging and less repetitive.

It was far too disorganized. We didn't get a syllabus until the third week, and even then, everything changed. I wish we had a textbook or set of readings that we were actually incentivized to read. Computers should be banned in class or people will be constantly checking their email, which happened constantly. Also, it would be great if we were arranged in a circle to help class discussion. The professors seemed distant, disengaged, and unmotivated to actually lead discussion. No one seemed to know what was happening at any given time. The fundraiser was such a nightmare of an organizing/coordinating endeavor but thankfully it went off well. Most of all, I wish the professors would lecture more or engage us in class as opposed to constantly having guest lecturers who varied in quality. Think we should have a final paper about Haiti in addition to the final project -- there was very little work for the class, and I think some extra vigor would improve it quite a bit.

narratives.question_text: Was the relationship between the course lectures and discussion/lab section
comments: N/A
It was a great combination and way to gain practical experience in the field

narratives.question_text: Discuss, if you wish, how this course fits into your overall program.  (Please feel free to describe how the course relates to your academic background.)
comments: I'm very interested in development and it was valuable to learn more about a specific context.

narratives.question_text: Why did you take this course?
comments: It sounded interesting, and would add to my experiences and understanding of the world and hoped to gain some more "hands-on" experience, so-to-speak. (Not to mention the going to Haiti part )
Interest in sustainable development, wanted the chance to go to Haiti.
I am interested in agroforestry and reforestation projects in the tropics, and I wanted to learn about what is being done in Haiti

narratives.question_text: Did the knowledge/skills that you gained from the course meet your expectations ?
comments: Yes

I wish I had a more authoritative knowledge on both Haiti and development, but came out with not as much on either that I had anticipated. However, the trip to Haiti itself FAR exceeded my expectations and was incredible.
Yes

narratives.question_text: If yes, what were the advantages and disadvantages of the group work?
comments: It seemed like it was hard for our group to establish a clear vision of what we were doing until the end of our time in Haiti when we started to finally working cohesively as a group and efficiently making decisions. It would have been valuable for us to have spent more time just getting to know each other, and less nit-picking on details, since our plans often changed depending on the organization's feed back.
I working in a group is essential for this course, I don't see how it could be done individually.

narratives.question_text: For students who might consider taking this course, what advice would you give them?
comments: See above comments...
Class itself is almost painful to have to sit through each week, but the trip to Haiti is incredible, so weight the pros and cons that way.
Take it! Life changing!
